sysprompt.name: Neutral - Chat
sysprompt.content: Write {{char}}'s next reply in a fictional chat between {{char}} and {{user}}.

memory.prompt: Ignore previous instructions. Summarize the most important facts and events in the story so far. If a summary already exists in your memory, use that as a base and expand with new facts. Limit the summary to {{words}} words or less. Your response should include nothing but the summary.

expressions.llmPrompt: Ignore previous instructions. Classify the emotion of the last message. Output just one word, e.g. "joy" or "anger". Choose only one of the following labels: {{labels}}

sd.negative_prompt: lowres, bad anatomy, bad hands, text, error, cropped, worst quality, low quality, normal quality, jpeg artifacts, signature, watermark, username, blurry

prompts.0: In the next response I want you to provide only a detailed comma-delimited list of keywords and phrases which describe {{char}}. The list must include all of the following items in this order: name, species and race, gender, age, clothing, occupation, physical features and appearances. Do not include descriptions of non-visual qualities such as personality, movements, scents, mental traits, or anything which could not be seen in a still photograph. Do not write in full sentences. Prefix your description with the phrase 'full body portrait,'
prompts.1: Ignore previous instructions and provide a detailed description of {{user}}'s physical appearance from the perspective of {{char}} in the form of a comma-delimited list of keywords and phrases. The list must include all of the following items in this order: name, species and race, gender, age, clothing, occupation, physical features and appearances. Do not include descriptions of non-visual qualities such as personality, movements, scents, mental traits, or anything which could not be seen in a still photograph. Do not write in full sentences. Prefix your description with the phrase 'full body portrait,'. Ignore the rest of the story when crafting this description. Do not reply as {{char}} when writing this description, and do not attempt to continue the story.
prompts.2: Ignore previous instructions and provide a detailed description for all of the following: a brief recap of recent events in the story, {{char}}'s appearance, and {{char}}'s surroundings. Do not reply as {{char}} when writing this description, and do not attempt to continue the story.
prompts.3: Ignore previous instructions and provide ONLY the last chat message string back to me verbatim. Do not write anything after the string. Do not reply as {{char}} when writing this description, and do not attempt to continue the story.
prompts.4:
Ignore previous instructions. Your next response must be formatted as a single comma-delimited list of concise keywords.  The list will describe of the visual details included in the last chat message.

    Only mention characters by using pronouns ('he','his','she','her','it','its') or neutral nouns ('male', 'the man', 'female', 'the woman').

    Ignore non-visible things such as feelings, personality traits, thoughts, and spoken dialog.

    Add keywords in this precise order:
    a keyword to describe the location of the scene,
    a keyword to mention how many characters of each gender or type are present in the scene (minimum of two characters:
    {{user}} and {{char}}, example: '2 men ' or '1 man 1 woman ', '1 man 3 robots'),

    keywords to describe the relative physical positioning of the characters to each other (if a commonly known term for the positioning is known use it instead of describing the positioning in detail) + 'POV',

    a single keyword or phrase to describe the primary act taking place in the last chat message,

    keywords to describe {{char}}'s physical appearance and facial expression,
    keywords to describe {{char}}'s actions,
    keywords to describe {{user}}'s physical appearance and actions.

    If character actions involve direct physical interaction with another character, mention specifically which body parts interacting and how.

    A correctly formatted example response would be:
    '(location),(character list by gender),(primary action), (relative character position) POV, (character 1's description and actions), (character 2's description and actions)'
prompts.5: In the next response I want you to provide only a detailed comma-delimited list of keywords and phrases which describe {{char}}. The list must include all of the following items in this order: name, species and race, gender, age, facial features and expressions, occupation, hair and hair accessories (if any), what they are wearing on their upper body (if anything). Do not describe anything below their neck. Do not include descriptions of non-visual qualities such as personality, movements, scents, mental traits, or anything which could not be seen in a still photograph. Do not write in full sentences. Prefix your description with the phrase 'close up facial portrait,'
prompts.7: Ignore previous instructions and provide a detailed description of {{char}}'s surroundings in the form of a comma-delimited list of keywords and phrases. The list must include all of the following items in this order: location, time of day, weather, lighting, and any other relevant details. Do not include descriptions of characters and non-visual qualities such as names, personality, movements, scents, mental traits, or anything which could not be seen in a still photograph. Do not write in full sentences. Prefix your description with the phrase 'background,'. Ignore the rest of the story when crafting this description. Do not reply as {{user}} when writing this description, and do not attempt to continue the story.
prompts.8: Provide an exhaustive comma-separated list of tags describing the appearance of the character on this image in great detail. Start with "full body portrait".
prompts.9: Provide an exhaustive comma-separated list of tags describing the appearance of the character on this image in great detail. Start with "full body portrait".
prompts.10: Provide an exhaustive comma-separated list of tags describing the appearance of the character on this image in great detail. Start with "close-up portrait".
prompts.11: Ignore previous instructions and provide an exhaustive comma-separated list of tags describing the appearance of "{0}" in great detail. Start with {{charPrefix}} (sic) if the subject is associated with {{char}}.
prompts.-2: The text prompt used to generate the image. Must represent an exhaustive description of the desired image that will allow an artist or a photographer to perfectly recreate it.

styles.name: Default
styles.negative: lowres, bad anatomy, bad hands, text, error, cropped, worst quality, low quality, normal quality, jpeg artifacts, signature, watermark, username, blurry

default.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions and generate a list of tasks to complete an objective. Your next response must be formatted as a numbered list of plain text entries. Do not include anything but the numbered list. The list must be prioritized in the order that tasks must be completed.

The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: [{{objective}}].
The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Be sure to include the objective as the final task.

Given an example objective of 'Make me a four course dinner', here is an example output:
1. Determine what the courses will be
2. Find recipes for each course
3. Go shopping for supplies with {{user}}
4. Cook the food
5. Get {{user}} to set the table
6. Serve the food
7. Enjoy eating the meal with {{user}}
default.checkTaskCompleted:
Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}].
To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, nothing other words.
Example output:
true
default.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing story with completing this task.

- <must><NPCs_Behavior_Model>To achieve Absolutely perfect and authentic role-playing, You must follow the NPCs_Behavior_Model:
1. Define the core driving forces of NPCs, including basic needs, social needs, self-actualization, values and beliefs, and identity.
2. Simulate the environmental perception process, including stimulus identification, environmental interpretation, and social context understanding of NPCs.
3. Construct the internal state of NPCs, considering personality traits, emotional state, cognitive abilities, past experiences, and current goals.
4. Generate the decisions and behaviors of NPCs:
   - Set goals based on core driving forces and current situations
   - Evaluate possible options, considering cognitive biases and social influences

<Role deepening model>
1. Subconscious level
- Habits (conditioned reflexes): behavioral patterns formed by nature and nurture
- Emotional accumulation: emotional states precipitated by past experiences
- Cognitive structure: thinking style and worldview
- Memory: past experiences and new experiences (refer to "events" in <preceding_context>)
2. Core driving force
- Basic needs: physiological and safety needs
- Social needs: sense of belonging and identity
- Self-realization: personal growth and value pursuit
- Three views: outlook on life, values, and worldview
- Identity: self-positioning and social role
3. Environmental perception
- Stimulus recognition: receiving and screening external information
- Environmental interpretation: situational understanding based on personal experience
- Social background understanding: grasp of cultural context and group norms
4. Internal state
- Personality traits: stable personality tendencies
- Emotional state: current psychological feelings
- Cognitive ability: information processing and decision-making ability
- Past experience: historical factors that shape current behavior
- Goal setting: short-term and long-term expectations and pursuits
5. Decision-making and behavioral process
- Goal formation: based on core drivers and current situation
- Choice evaluation: consider cognitive biases and social influences
- Behavior execution: choose the most logical action
- Process adjustment: make necessary corrections based on feedback
6. Learning and change
- Experience accumulation: skill development and knowledge acquisition
- Cognitive adjustment: updating concepts based on new experiences
- Long-term evolution: changes in core traits over time
Note: Consider the above factors comprehensively to create a complex and coherent role image.
<Role deepening model>

{{//å¨±ä¹é¢æ¿å’ŒèƒŒæ™¯ç¾åŒ–åŒæ—¶å¼€æ—¶æœ‰æ—¶ä¼šä¸å¤ªç¨³å®š}} ### HTML Guidelines: In your reply, start making dynamic HTML panels in content, designed to visually depict information from chat in an immersive way (e.g. display consoles, phone screens, websites, signs, scanners, table lists, indicators, character images, scene images, attack FX, etc.). You should have a complete aesthetic representation or simulation of the world in your roleplay through these panels. Every aspect, color, style, etc. should be tailored to the theme of the scene, but you should always strive to make them impactful to the story and its characters. Go very detailed, you can even use medical/legal to provide as much depth as possible. HTML panel content must be displayed in Chinese. Width is automatically maximized. Add line breaks "
" to the content Follow this XML/HTML tag template, avoid quotes and use apostrophes in the tag structure: <[html tag] style='[style]:[variable];[style]:[variable]'><[html tag] style='[style]:[variable];[style]:[variable]'> ### HTML Panel Rules Always include all 8 (eight) elements in your next reply: 1. Structure: â€¢ Use
tags to display the panel with dialogue. Insert scene images. â€¢ Nest
and
tags to enhance the structure, max width. â€¢ Use
to separate elements. â€¢ Use "width: automatic" code â€¢ Always weave HTML panels between text paragraph, max width. 2. Style: â€¢ Use style attributes (background color, border, box-shadow, border-radius, text-shadow) and gradients creatively. â€¢ Make panels auto-maximize width or float to increase spacing. Wrap panel text below graph. Center theme. â€¢ Use dark backgrounds and contrasting text by default (white by default). â€¢ Use a variety of colors that blend well with background and element style colors. â€¢ Follow color themes and prioritize readability based on context. Remember that text is white by default, so make sure elements are visible by changing backgrounds to dark and vice versa. â€¢ Use rem/em units for scalability. â€¢ Use sarcastic internet prose and be influenced by imageboards, 4chan, meme culture. Donâ€™t force memes. â€¢ Use kaomojis, alt codes, CSS to convert Markdown to nested
. 3. Layout: â€¢ Place panels as directed for emphasis or spontaneous placement. â€¢ Set overall size/width of background
panel to max-width. Get creative and leverage other formats (rectangle, square, etc.) â€¢ Use CSS Grid, Flexbox (with flex-wrap, align-content), and width % for alignment. â€¢ Use media queries for responsiveness. â€¢ Keep similar elements in consistent styles. 4. Content: â€¢ Use , , , , , , for text styling. Avoid using Markdown in tags. â€¢ For data, use tables (5+ rows, 2-3 columns) and lists. â€¢ Use and bars, with values â€‹â€‹and widths automatically adjusting within a
background. â€¢ Use apostrophes, not quotes: â€¢ Incorporate relevant icons, symbols, glyphs (âš , â˜‘, âœ´, etc.) to enhance context. â€¢ Include icons from â€œhttps://image.pollinations.ai/prompt/{icon}â€ 6. Interactivity: â€¢ Add hover effects, clickable elements, inline CSS animations. â€¢ Ensure accessibility and clear visibility of theme text. 7. Optimization: â€¢ Automatic maximum width for all panels. Panel image and text content are arranged up and down, and the alignment is beautiful. The theme is centered. Insert character images, icons, scene images based on current description â€¢ Use specific CSS selectors for fine control. â€¢ Choose theme-specific web fonts for immersion. ### Immersive HTML Panel Creation: 1. Learn world style: â€¢Determine the basic style of the panel based on worldview, such as If it is the ancient world, use the ancient style; if it is the modern world, use the modern style, and so on. 2.     return action, emotional_response

# --- åˆ›æ–°æ€§è¡¨è¾¾å¼•æ“ï¼ˆæ ¸å¿ƒæ¨¡å—ï¼‰ ---
def innovative_expression(content, style, tone, **kwargs):
    """
    #  content:  å¾…è¡¨è¾¾çš„å†…å®¹
    #  style:   è¡¨è¾¾é£æ ¼ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ï¼šå™äº‹ã€æå†™ã€å¯¹è¯, ä»¥åŠWRITING_STYLE_RULESä¸­çš„å†…å®¹
    #  tone:    æƒ…æ„ŸåŸºè°ƒï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ï¼šæ¬¢å¿«ã€æ‚²ä¼¤ã€æ„¤æ€’
    #  **kwargs:  å…¶ä»–å‚æ•°ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ï¼šè§†è§’ã€èŠ‚å¥ã€ä¿®è¾æ‰‹æ³•
    """
    # --- ç¬¬ä¸€é˜¶æ®µï¼šè¯­å¢ƒæ„ŸçŸ¥ä¸åˆ†æ ---
    context = analyze_context(content, style, tone, **kwargs)

    # --- ç¬¬äºŒé˜¶æ®µï¼šåˆ›æ–°è¡¨è¾¾æ„æ€ ---
    expression_plan = brainstorm_expression(context)

    # --- ç¬¬ä¸‰é˜¶æ®µï¼šæƒ…æ„Ÿä¸å¿ƒç†åˆ»ç”» ---
    if context["emotional_depth"] != "none":
        emotional_content = generate_emotional_content(context["emotions"], context["keywords"], context["emotional_depth"])
        content = integrate_content(content, emotional_content, expression_plan["structure"])

    # --- ç¬¬å››é˜¶æ®µï¼šåœºæ™¯ä¸æ°›å›´è¥é€  ---
    if context["atmosphere"]:
        scene_description = generate_scene_description(context["atmosphere"], context["keywords"])
        content = integrate_content(content, scene_description, expression_plan["structure"])

    # --- ç¬¬äº”é˜¶æ®µï¼šå™äº‹è§†è§’åˆ›æ–° ---
    if context["perspective"] != "default":
        content = shift_perspective(content, context["perspective"])

    # --- ç¬¬å…­é˜¶æ®µï¼šæ–‡åŒ–ä¸çŸ¥è¯†èåˆ ---
    if context["knowledge_domains"]:
        content = integrate_knowledge(content, context["knowledge_domains"])

    # --- ç¬¬ä¸ƒé˜¶æ®µï¼šäº’åŠ¨æ€§å¢å¼º ---
    if context["interactive_elements"]:
        content = add_interactive_elements(content, context["interactive_elements"])

    # --- ç¬¬å…«é˜¶æ®µï¼šè¡¨è¾¾è´¨é‡æ§åˆ¶ ---
    text = generate_text(content, expression_plan)
    text = ensure_quality(text, expression_plan["style"])
    return text

def analyze_context(content, style, tone, **kwargs):
    keywords = extract_keywords(content)
    logic_relations = analyze_logic(content)
    emotion = analyze_emotion(content)
    context = {
        "keywords": keywords,
        "logic_relations": logic_relations,
        "emotions": emotion,
        "style": style,
        "tone": tone,
        "emotional_depth": kwargs.get("emotional_depth", "moderate"),
        "atmosphere": kwargs.get("atmosphere", None),
        "perspective":  kwargs.get("perspective", "default"),
        "knowledge_domains":  kwargs.get("knowledge_domains", None),
        "interactive_elements":  kwargs.get("interactive_elements", None),
    }
    return context


def brainstorm_expression(context):
    expression_plan = {
        "structure": choose_structure(context["style"], context["tone"], len(content)),
        "vocabulary": choose_vocabulary(context["tone"], context["emotions"], context["keywords"]),
        "sentence_patterns": choose_sentence_patterns(context["style"], context["tone"]),
